Reviews.Title: “Great price and location, but rock hard beds”
Reviews.Author: MaldivesComplete
Reviews.Content: My wife an I were looking for a cheap place to crash after an evening out in London. A quick Internet search came up with the Hallam. At £75 for 2 people with (as it turns out, a decent) breakfast included just a few blocks from the West End, it was hard to argue. The room was plenty clean and in decent condition. Okay, one bed lamp was missing a lampshade, but otherwise it exceeded my expectations. The shower was strong and hot. The big downer was the bed was simply rock hard which made for a less comfortable night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “book a well rated hostel instead”
Reviews.Author: cafe_a
Reviews.Content: Everything in this hotel is extremely dirty and old. The curtains were so dirty that they became sticky and grey, the carpet and bed sheets and the table cloth at breakfast were full of stains and the furniture was in a very bad condition. the bathroom was smelly and very humid. the single room I stayed in was very small, there was even no space to properly open the suitcase. The reception staff was polite but clearly not bothered to help with anything. I was to stay 3 times in this hotel over next months, but I cancelled my reservations after staying there 1 time. The location is good indeed, but there are lots of other accomodations in the area. definitely NOT recommended for anyone who would wish for at least basic comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Very good priced accomodation for location in London”
Reviews.Author: Angela W
Reviews.Content: I had read a few reviews which made me nervous about staying here. However, the location and price were fantastic and I thought one night won't hurt, just a bed to crash after sightseeing and a good night out. Hotel staff were ok, nothing special but room was clean, good size and we had plenty of hot water for a shower both days. Central heating worked very well for a chilly weekend. Breakfast was also OK- value for money but tasted nice. In all, for 1 nights stay I cannot complain. I paid a budget price for a budget hotel but was 5 mins walk from Oxford Street and 15 mins from Soho so the location is fantastic. I would highly recommend for anyone staying for 1 night weekend trip for sightseeing etc.

Reviews.Title: “Poor upkeeping and customer service”
Reviews.Author: mkaleem
Reviews.Content: Reception staff was polite but did not know how to resolve issues. Firstly TV was broken and reception staff spent half hour fiddling with it without any luck. Shower curtain was dirty and mouldy, dirty water built up in the shower cubicle due to blocked drain. Room was uncomfortably cold with no access to heating. Manager did not have courtesy to even call and apologise inspite of leaving written comments of dissatisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “homely”
Reviews.Author: moonraker186220
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last December very convenient for us as close to London Palladium.the staff were very pleasant, breakfast ,full english very good ,room lovely and warm.Only one complaint the shower did not work.I would stay at the Hallam again .

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel, but too small and unsafe”
Reviews.Author: VagoBaku
Reviews.Content: Well, the price for this hotel is relatively small but the rooms condition is very bad. The rooms are tiny and unsafe as for fire (you can get stuck in your room if any emergency), the lift (old fashioned steel grating) and you can hit the things in your room and be injured. If you are a big person you should not stay there for sure. The top floor is the worst one.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but awful!”
Reviews.Author: 08PJT1966
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideally located for a meeting that I was attending the next day and at the price appeared to be worth the risk. I would not recommend that anyone else takes the same risk. I stayed here at the end of last year and my room was filthy. I tried to have a shower and the water was freezing cold, even after being left to run for a long time. I will never stay here again and would not recommend that anyone else, even my worst enemy, does!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: lal11
Reviews.Content: I was here for two nights, for a business meeting. The hotel was booked by the company, since it was nearby the meeting place. Good position, terrible hotel.The reservation was not found on my arrival, but of course they had free rooms. Single room very small and dirty. Chair falling into pieces. Better not to look at the bedspread. Very old and tiny bathroom, so tiny that the basin was in the room. Not possible to leave the luggage during the day after checking out because they dont have where to put it. Not possible to get from the desk any information on London. Not possible to open the window.

Reviews.Title: “about what you would expect for the price”
Reviews.Author: fatcontroller1999
Reviews.Content: let's face it, hotel prices in central london are ridiculously high. So for 90 pounds a night for a single room you're not going to get anything fancy. On the plus side, it's in a great location, convenient for several tube lines and minutes walk from oxford circus. The staff are friendly and attentive and it comes with free breakfast and cheap wifi (5 pounds a day) and has en suite bath/shower. On the down side, the room i got was tiny and very poorly insulated against sound from the 2 neighboring rooms , in addition the fire door to the 3 rooms on the top level had no damper resulting in a loud bang avery time someone came or went. I didn't mind that there were 2 additional flights of stairs beyond the last lift stop, but it felt like things were crammed in a little too tight. The room was a little jaded - paint peeling, worn carpets, slight musty smell but i have (unfortunately) stayed in much worse places. Next time i need to stay in london i'll check out the astor court next door to the hallam hotel - looked a little more spacious and up to date, and only 10 pounds a night more. Overall, I would only stay here again if i really had no other options.

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy, didn't even stay for the second night”
Reviews.Author: CityChick770
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here as part of a mid-week break in London. I had booked online thinking a three star guest house near Oxford Street couldn't be all that bad. We weren't planning on spending much time in the hotel so thought that even if it was basic it would be fine as long as everything was clean and in decent condition. To be fair, the room seemed clean, it even smelt of bleach! It was not however in a good location nor in great condition. The room was at basement level, right next to the kitchen and the corridor stank of curried food. In the morning after the one night that we stayed, the tiny bathroom smelt like a fried breakfast and there was lots of rattling of crockery and cutlery and staff conversation right outside our bedroom door as the breakfast service was underway. The rumbling of nearby tube trains and trucks on the road outside added to a less than tranquil environment. The lighting in the room was dim and the carpet worn. The double bed was quite small (in both directions!) and we both had sore backs after sleeping in it. There was only one plug socket in the room and no full length mirror. The fittings in the bathroom were ancient - the window blind was damaged, the shower cubicle was small and the fixed shower head pointed directly at the shower curtain (hanging from its rusty rail) which resulted in flooding of the bathroom floor. In addition, the water drained from the shower tray so slowly that you ended up standing in three inches of water after a minute or two. We couldn't wait to get out of the hotel after staying the one night and just left early the next morning. Nobody asked us about our stay when we handed over the key, or even realised we were leaving a day early, and nobody at the hotel has been in contact with me since to ask. They got our money so they probably don't care. I think I have only stayed in one other place ever that felt as tatty and miserable as this hotel. It is the one part of our mini-break that I would gladly forget.

Reviews.Title: “Hallam Hotel London”
Reviews.Author: gordieallan
Reviews.Content: I have read with interest all the negative comments about this hotel. Ok, it's not the Savoy, however it is clean, quiet and comfortable. I have just booked for my second stay in October 2011. The first time i booked in there I hadn't read the poor reviews until two days before I arrived. I entered in trepidation expecting creaking doors, cobwebs and howling wolves in the background. Complete crap! It's a basic 2 star hotel in Central London. Small, yes but entirely adequate. After all when you are in London you don't spend much time in your hotel. All you need is somewhere to rest your weary feet or sleep off your over-indulgence at the many London pubs; well I do anyway. As i say, completely adequate, reasonably priced and convenient. Just don't expect too much and you will be OK.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AliABedfordshire Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: As per other realistic reviews, knowing this is likely to be half the price of other hotels amenable to West end locations, just manage your expectations! My daughter and I were sightseeing and only needed to rest our heads for the night, so Hallam was just what we needed, being clean, warm and comfortable. Stayed in Room 2 on lower ground, comfy beds, clean linen, TV and tea tray, with tiny ensuite requiring safecracker skills to get the shower at the right temperature, but nonetheless couldn't complain for Â£94!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. Ticked All Boxes.”
Reviews.Author: Noelsguitar
Reviews.Content: Let's get real. This hotel is in central London and is Â£68pppn, including breakfast. That's the reason both you and I will have booked it. So, my expectations were that it would be in an ideal location, and somewhere basic for us to spend the night. What we got was exactly that. The check in process was quick, and we were allowed to check in early. Our rooms were no smaller or larger than any other hotel of this budget that I have stayed in. A highlight was the breakfast. Full english cooked to order, with personal preferences accommodated too. Annoyances were a missing plug for the sink, and a bathroom in need of redecoration. If your expectations of a 2* hotel, are that of a 5* one, you will be disappointed. If however, you need an inexspensive hotel in the centre of London, with somewhere to spend the night. You have found what you are looking for. And you'll love the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value near Oxford Street”
Reviews.Author: sheilds
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel, and within that category it offers clean rooms, towels changed and room cleaned daily.and breakfast of eggs, bacon, toast, juice, coffee or tea. Location very good for shopping on Oxford Street, and walkable to Madame Tousads, and a 15 minute walk to Piccadilly, Leicester Square, Soho and theaters. There is an elevator (not always provided in this class of hotel) and a small bar in the reception area where one can get a drink. A money saving "cabin" room for a single person is OK if you really don't mind small spaces. I sail 100 year old windjammers, and this room is about the same size as a ships cabin. Only complaint is that the web site mentioned wifi, but did not mention the 5 pound per day fee.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't as bad as feared!”
Reviews.Author: Shaunalan
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hallam as a cheap, well located London hotel as we were attending a show. Then we saw the reviews and feared the worst. However our stay was not too bad, friendly welcome at reception, room reasonable size (double), but very small and compact in every sense. Shower feeble and lacked room, sink in the room (not in the en-suite) seemed to be blocked. Breakfast next day was good. Given the price and the location one can't be too critical and we would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel at your peril, you've been warned.”
Reviews.Author: Metalmickey33
Reviews.Content: Customer service on reception could be better. Room on 5th floor, lift only goes to 4th. Single bed in room. Have seen bigger box rooms. Tea and coffee in rooms - ok. Small tv, no controls. Unable to lock room from inside. Carpet filthy. Room stank. Water marks on wall from leak near ceiling. Mattress felt damp. Linen clean but not ironed. Bathroom, decent size and superficially clean. Blind on window disgusting - did not touch. Shower curtain mould stained. Shower - literally no more than a trickle of water. Did not wait around for breakfast, couldn't ge out quick enough. Centrally located in London, would rather stay further out and commute in. Seriously, don't book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at All Costs!”
Reviews.Author: Mummypeaches
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by a booking agency through my company. The single room I occupied was no more than a cupboard. It was the length of a single bed and only slightly wider! The bed was very high up and on investigation, was actually a wooden box with a matress on top. The white paint on the walls was extremely grubby with black smudges all over. The shower in the adjacent bathroom was fixed to the wall so the spray pointed up instead of down. The hose just leaked water, which never went above tepid. The staff were indifferent at best and seemed surprised that I was not happy in this cupboard. Please, just give Harry Potter his room back!

Reviews.Title: “If I didn't laugh I'd cry!”
Reviews.Author: mooning_88
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the 'Cabin Room', people are not lying when they state it is small, I could not fit in the room with the rucksack on my back, nor could I get dressed properly in the mornings. The bed is not a full size single, and the length of the room is the bed with a well placed wall mirror to give the appearance of depth. I could sit against the wall and put my legs across the bed width ways and my feel would touch the wall in front of me. A padded cell offers more freedom. I could physically touch both walls length ways at the same time. The en-suite is private, which is a plus, but it is small. I think this is fine considering the (lack of) size of the room. The shower head didn't work properly: it was broken at the head which meant that the water sprayed out in any direction and as the wall attachment had broken you had to hold the shower in your hand to shower at all. This is bearable, just. The previously mentioned are singularly annoying but collectively they become a joke. I wish I could say that the issues I had with the room stopped there.... The floor was sticky! Actually sticky. I don't mean the bathroom, I mean the actual bedroom carpet and I advise anyone who is staying there to not walk around barefoot, keep the shoes and socks on at all times! The bed sheets were not clean, or if they were, they were not adequately so. The bed was well made upon arrival (which suggests an admirable dexterity considering the size of the room) but when I pulled the sheets back I had to remove a number of hairs and other bits and pieces, it was not pleasant. I was convinced when sleeping that the bed was incredibly itchy and this did not make for a comfortable sleep (this may have been psychological, but based upon the condition I found the sheets in, I don't think so). The mattress also has a very high lip to it, which is quite uncomfortable, and seeing as the bed is not as wide as an average single, if you make any motion to turn over, you will feel this hard and high lip. Be warned. The bedroom door is not a full sized door-way either, which I suppose is to be expected considering this is a glorified broom cupboard. It is about 1.5ft wide, so keep that in mind. Perhaps the most disgusting thing was discovering some old, dirty male underwear on a shelf above the door, and goodness knows how long that has been there for. It really was the straw that broke the camel's back and I remember ringing my friends to describe the cell I was currently in finding it amusing (if I hadn't of laughed I would have been in tears). The hotel, or rather the cabin room I stayed in, is over priced. London is a very walkable city and one can easily get about quickly and without complication. If you are wanting a hotel that offers you a great location, the Hallam - on paper - offers that, but I would imagine there are better hotels around (in fact I know there are). If you do not know London and feel unsure about getting a hotel slightly further away, never fear, it really is easy to get around and I would suggest this over this hotel any day. I won't be staying there again. There were some positives, however, and it would be remiss of me not to mention them. The staff were all very friendly, always smiling and wishing the guests a good day/evening/night etc. The breakfast was a choice of either a full english or a continental (cereals). This is served promptly upon your arrival in the mornings in the hotel's basement. It provides enough to start your day. A weird quirk is that you have to leave your room key at the desk whenever your leave the hotel, even if you're popping to the Sainsbury's local for 2 mins. I suppose this means they know you're out of the room and can thus 'clean' it. Who knows. I won't be staying there again, nor will I recommend it to others, but it has provided me with a number of stories to tell my friends. I enquired about Wifi and was told that there was a paid wifi available at Â£5 a night, I decided against this so cannot comment on the speed etc.

Reviews.Title: “AAAAAAH run away as fast you as you can!”
Reviews.Author: yvonne_c_dijkman
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the cheap prices, don't be fooled by the pictures. Trust these reviews. It is a absolutely terrible hotel. As I write this, I have to sit out another 10 nights in this dreadful hotel because my company booked it for me, but if I could I would pack my bags right now and find something else. When I arrived in this hotel the first room they gave me was dirty and the shower head was just lying on the floor. Nothing to hang it up on. The second room (obviously I complained) was a bit better, but I still found hairs in my bed, and the shower was just simply not a proper shower due to the lack of hot water. The third room still had a bad shower, bed was to short en still not clean. Tired of having to move my bags, I stayed in the last room. I complained about the shower once more, but they simply told me that the lack of power (water) is because of the fact that nothing actually happened to the hotel in the past 40 years. So the plumbing hasn't been renewed for the past 40 years.... Nice, that really helped me :S. So now to wash my hair I have appointments at the hairdresser for 32 pounds, because the hotel can't provide me with a proper shower. No as I am writing this, I actually have no shower at all. Due to construstion work they simply shut the hot water off. Without any notice to the hotel quest. So please after reading this, don't be fooled by the 1 or 2 good reviews this hotel has. It's simply bad.

Reviews.Title: “Small is bearable but dirty is not and cold water really is essential.”
Reviews.Author: Hoverhoo
Reviews.Content: A room for Â£75 which included breakfast seemed reasonable for London. I know I can get a better deal from a chain but I wanted to feel safe walking back to my hotel after an evening seminar at Birkbeck University. The warning that the room was a 'cabin room' was welcome honesty, which I took as a guide to the nature of the proprietor. This was a mistake on my part. As I was on business I only needed space to sleep and a bathroom. The room was the size of a cupboard and the rail for hanging clothes was higher than the door (in order that the door could pass under it), at 5'3'' this was very difficult to use. However, there was a bed, bedside table, a box of tissues, a window, a phone, a tv, cup with tea and coffee. The kettle was missing, so I called reception and on the second call they did send someone up with a kettle and a hair drier. With these two items added to the bedside table there wasn't room for anything else at all. The bedhead was extremely grimy cloth and the bed was not a full size single. The tv remote attached to the table had no batteries but they had provided another remote so the tv could be used. Although the view was fire escapes and offices, the windows (room and en-suite) did open for air. There was also a fan heater (which I didn't try) which propped the bedroom door open. The bedroom door was not a full-size door. The door from the hall opened into a space which was just adequate size to allow the door to be opened. This led to a tiny bathroom and the bedroom. I had a small backpack with me and had trouble getting into the room because of the restricted space. The doors had no interior locks at all (just opened with key from outside). I could touch both walls (room width) and there was just room to squash my bag (think school-backpack size) at the end of the bed (room length). It was a difficult space to get dressed in. The toilet seat was horrible. It was badly dis-coloured and had chips in the plastic. The shower head was too high for me to reach and not adjustable but I could remove it to hold (but couldn't reach to put it back). The shower curtain was the plastic, never washed and moldy kind. The cold tap did not work at all. I would have liked to avoid the shower (indeed avoid the bathroom full-stop) but you can't spend a day in London and not need a shower. The shower got very hot, which seemed good at first but it went on to become scalding (after I'd got soapy, of course). The temperature adjustment did not work at all. I tried all settings, while trying to hold the red hot metal shower-head away from me (remember I couldn't reach to put it back on the wall). All settings were scalding hot (even after waiting a while for a change in temperature). I tried turning the water off, waiting and turning it back on - still scalding. Decide to resort to trying to rinse using the tiny sink - but there was only the hot tap. Managed to get 3 glassfuls of warm water over my hair before this tap was scalding hot too. The hand towel was not clean - grey white. However it wasn't paper thin, so if they just gave the towels a boiling wash (they could even do it in-house with the temperature of their water), they could have acceptable towels. Unfortunately the sheets also needed a wash, the last person had brown hair and wore make-up - not facts you want to know from hotel bedsheets unless you are a forensic with CSI. The wall socket below the tv did not charge my phone - so it was a good job I can wake up without an alarm as my phone was dead by morning. It was also a good job I was dead tired because the room (14) is next to the lift shaft. After seeing the inside of the hotel I had opted to walk up to the 3rd floor as I didn't hold any hope of the lift being regularly serviced. Unfortunately others did not share this view and used the lift all night. In addition the bed was too small to move much (no problem of falling on the floor though as there wasn't enough room for a body - second thoughts: I could have got jammed between the wall and the bed and been there until the next guest checked in). Breakfast was a worrying thought. As it was inclusive my expenses would not stretch to buying alternative food and I had no idea if lunch would be provided at the seminar I was attending. Hence I made my way to the basement to eat. It was a relief to find it was edible. The crockery wasn't very clean (the person behind me asked for it to be changed) and my milk jug was only okay if I didn't put my reading glasses on. The tea was hot. There was one menu outside the dining room and a lady took the order. A choice of three cereals which were served to your table (no breakfast buffet); cornflakes, muesli and barnflakes (their spelling not mine). There were eggs, sausage, bacon, tomato and toast. No juice, white bread only and my eggs were scrambled. With the exception of the sausage (the cheapest of cheap sort) it was hot and passable but the cooked food arrived almost at the same time as the cereal (you could not have complained of slow service). All the other guests in the dining room were non-British European and I felt embarrassed that this is their experience of London hotels. I didn't complain because the proprietor (it seemed to be family run) must have known of these issues already and I would have been wasting my time with nothing to gain. I'd paid in advance. Unsurprisingly they didn't ask if my stay was comfortable or any other such departing enquiry. There's potential if they could be bothered: Wash the sheets, towels and shower curtain properly, fix the taps and water temperature, change the toilet-seat before it gets shabby and provide an interior lock. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIFIC”
Reviews.Author: sarah186220
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel which looks OK from the outside, we walked in, went into the reception area where the man behind the desk hardly acknowledged us, was very rude and all he was intersted in was getting his money. He then gave us the key for the room and that was it. We tried to call the lift which didnt come, so we looked around to see where are room was? we eventually found it. Opened the door and my first impression was OH MY GOD this is discusting, it was pitch black, the windows didnt open and the carpet was dirty. I then opened the bathroom door, to find the toliet almost in the shower it was absolutly tiny and again the shower was dirty. I didnt want to spend any time atall in the room, so left our stuff and we straight out. As i was going out the door my jacket seemed to be stuck? It had got caught on a nail sticking out of the door and make quite a large hole!! We came back to what we named the " flee pit " we went into the reception area to collect our room key to find the man asleep on the sofa!!! Going into breakfast the next morning we we'nt expecting much. A lady who was dressed very scuffy handed us a menu, whilst cleaning our table she wiped all the crumbs on to the chair!!!! I would NEVER stay at this hotel again, the staff were extremely rude, the hotel was dirty, dark and very unwelcomming. Who ever gave the hotel 3 *'s clearly was drunk when doing the inspection!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OMG WORST hotel...please read before you book!!!”
Reviews.Author: FunkyMunkyLIverpool
Reviews.Content: Okay...this is our honest 'lenghty' review from our own personal experience! We have to travel up and down to London over the next 12 months at regular intervals for medical reasons. Bearing in mind the cost of this for flights etc we wanted to keep the accommodation 'reasonable' and in the right location. Therefore, the Hallam Hotel was priced really well and in the right area for us, so we booked. I have to admit that it was booked at short notice...so other than look at a few pictures online.....I didn't check on here first!! Oops! BIG mistake! So, we booked Feb 27th - March 2nd.....at a cost of Â£253 for bed and breakfast. We are not naive, and realised that for this price, the hotel would be a bit dated, but expected it to be clean. We are not fussy or typical moaners...just expect what we pay for...and this is a 3* Hotel so we did expect it to be 'okay'. When we got to the hotel, we were soaked through and just wanted to dump our luggage, get dried off and get a warm drink...but as we walked into the hotel, our hearts sank as it was dark and gloomy and not the cleanest! Anyway, the next thing that alarmed us was the notice displayed on the desk stating "We do not accept responsibility for personal items/luggage in this hotel" or words to that effect. That wasn't a good sign.. we asked if there was a safe for guests...and there wasn't! Hmmm... We got the key for our room....and went to it. As we went into the room we just ground to a halt and stared around in dismay! It was GRIM!!!! All I will say is look at the photo's I'm adding to this review and make your own judgement about it. My partner told me he wasn't sleeping in it, and neither was I! So, the drowned rats went back to reception and asked for a refund. I told the receptionist that the room was like the Temple of Doom and that we were not sleeping or leaving our luggage etc in it! We were told it was POLICY that we couldn't get the money back. After a long 'erm..debate.....the outcome was that we could see the pictures online before nwe booked. Our argument was that the pics must have been taken years ago....and obviously when they had a cleaner!!! We said that it wasn't that we just didn't bother about staying there, but that is was poorly advertised and we weren't getting what we were paying for..or had seen true pictures of! We ended up in a debate about this 'policy' and it not being on display for guests to actually read. He then offered us another room..so we thought we'd check it out since we were there. I got to the top set of stairs and the cigarette smoke nearly knocked me on my back..it was disgusting. I couldn't even venture through it to get to the room...so went back and gave him the key back! Anyway, we got a refund for the 2nd and 3rd night but lost the money for that night. The receptionist told us to take up the complaint with the people we booked through. At that point, I took the key back, and my camera, and went back to the room and took a selection of photo's to support our complaint!! We took the chance and walked the streets looking for another hotel rather than sleep in that one. Eventually we got somewhere but cost nearly Â£400 more (DRAT) but as it was the cup final day etc...there was literally "No room at the inn!" so we had to take what we could so we could get comfy. Needless to say we were hacked off and I complained to www.booking.com who liaised frequently with us...but we got no further with getting that 1st nigt's money back. Therefore, I feel that it is only fair to let others be fully aware of what they may encounter, should they consider booking the Hallam Hotel. We are back in London this week...but definitely not staying there!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what all the complaining is about?”
Reviews.Author: fairyy
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay in the Hallam Hotel for one night with my boyfriend as we had come to see 'Blood brothers'. After booking I had a look at the reviews and was concerned about staying at the hotel after the negative comments that had been made, but was too late to cancel. Now i wish i hadn't of worried so much. When we arrived the staff behind the desk were helpful and kind, informed us of when breakfast was and where our room was etc. We stayed in a double room on the second floor, it wasn't as small as i thought it would be after all the other comments made. The room had a double bed, two wardrobes, a desk, sink, television, hairdryer, fridge and tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was tiny with just a toilet and shower cubicle, but what more is needed?. There were no bed bugs and the room was extremely clean and tidy. Breakfast was lovely, full english and again the staff were very nice. We paid Â£89 for the room and breakfast was included, i'm not really sure what else people expect for the price and the good location?!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: SNM60795
Reviews.Content: I actually saw the room and checked out immediately, couldn't even stay for the night. Towels were gray. i am almost sure there would be bedbugs (which then i checked other people's reviews and there was), horrible staff. Was a 15 minute nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs, read the reviews !”
Reviews.Author: Outlook101
Reviews.Content: We needed a short stay near to broadcasting house, should have read the reviews, when most are negative sit up and take notice. Scruffy hotel, dingy corridors, a flap was open outside our room with a mushroom growing on it. Room was just not clean. Staff neither friendly or unfriendly. Asked for money for stay as soon as we checked in. For breakfast we both declined the egg, but were given one, grossly overdone. Sausage was dry, we heard it being reheated in the microwave. I would not stay here if it was for free!

Reviews.Title: “Last minute rip off”
Reviews.Author: JMGWales_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, booked at short notice it was one of the few places remaining close to where I needed to be. In future I'll be more inclined to do a little travel. Unfriendly staff who gave littleinformation on my 2 night stay, the 'lift' was the size of a shoe box and not at all safe looking so I took the stairs to the 4th floor each time. My room barely had enough space to get changed and sitting on the yellow stained toiled seat, I was almost in the shower the space was so small. Yes, it did have what was needed but... the bed spread was dirty, the cup unwashed, the kettle did not belong to it's base and so could not be used and the sink needed cleaned. Hugely disappointing and severly over priced. From reading some of the other reviews, it seems that most choose to stay here due to late bookings. I would not reccommend his hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is squalor not a hotel !”
Reviews.Author: cokephaedra
Reviews.Content: I booked my 22 year old daughter in for one night at short notice through 'Laterooms.com' advertised as a 3*. The room was as small as a cupboard with an unmade dirty bed, an unflushed soiled toilet!!! and a sink full of spat out toothpaste!! The ignorant guy on reception even refused to refund the money as there was no way my daughter was staying there. But as soon as I threatened to call the police as this was taking money under false pretence he gave it back. I will be writing to Laterooms.com to recommend this hotel is taken off their list.

Reviews.Title: “Hellish Hallam”
Reviews.Author: alisonware
Reviews.Content: After my wife received a hospital appointment with only a few days notice. We urgently required accomodation. Despite a comprehensive search through all search engines this Hotel was the only hotel with rooms available. Via Travel Republic. We paid Â£200 for a double room and was told that we had been given a Â£35 discount. We were in room 19 on fourth floor and was concerned as if there had been a fire would we have escped? Frankly we would rather have slept on a park bench! The room was pokey, dirty and the last straw was when i went to mini bar for cold drink to find it was empty apart from the last occupants half eaten dinner. The shower was useless and impossible to wash properly. I could go on but frankly can't be bothered. Just avoid as its a total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING - AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: pogopogoLeicester
Reviews.Content: Me and my mum stayed at this hotel for one night as we needed a resonable place to stay for the night after going to see a show in the haymarket. on our arrival the receptionist was unfriendly, hardly communicated with us at all, we got to our room and were disappointed it was very dated and unclean, dirt, hairs everywhere and the sink was blocked. the bed stunk and made us physically feel sick, and when in bed we were itching all over, there were strange noises all night and we had no sleep, in the morning we went to breakfast - big mistake it was terrible!! wish now had paid the extra and stayed somewhere CLEAN!! in my opinion the hotel is not a 3 star and should be closed!! avoid at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “Proceed with caution”
Reviews.Author: Raziel_10
Reviews.Content: Dilapidated furniture, stained carpets, dust and fluff pervasive, yellowed toilet seat.....bad nights sleep

Reviews.Title: “forget it”
Reviews.Author: trevski285
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel because it is near harley street where we needed to go,we had to book last minute to fit in with fertility treament and in our budget it was the only hotel that a room available on that date so we booked . after booking i looked it up on trip advisor and was worried about the reviews i read. hopeing that it wasnt as bad as it sounded, we checked in there was this horrible curry smell when entering the lobby ,we did stay reluctently as we did not have time to sort anything else out but i would never go back it was awful ,i would advise to pay a little more and hope for better. and also use the service of trip advisor [before booking next time].also outside the hotel there is a massive building project underconstruction which was very noisey and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: czdasa1
Reviews.Content: Never again. I have never paid more for an accommodation and it was never worse then this one. Smell, dirty, small, that you cannot even move there. breakfast, that I couldnt eat because I was afraid to get sick out of that. Thank you, never more!

Reviews.Title: “...and worst of all”
Reviews.Author: Marianna_10
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 4 nights, stayed there many years ago and it was quite good, so was surprised at how cheap it was . I should have known better. No light in lift, shower hanging down, loo seat completely removable, grubby , no bed-side table. Moved to another room. It was a little better, not much. But worst of all I woke in the middle of the night to find my bed full of bed bugs. When we complained nobody cared and we left the next morning informing them that we weren't paying. We had to push the receptionist into going up and looking at the corpses in the bed .

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: Rach0071
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed there, though were immediately disappointed. Extremely rude and unhelpful staff upon arrival. Our bedroom was in the basement next to the breakfast room and our beds held up by paint pots. The mouldy shower, aka small cupboard was disgraceful. A great location though it really is worth spending an extra Â£30 and going somewhere else, couldn't wait to leave!

Reviews.Title: “If location is everything, then this hotel has everything!”
Reviews.Author: ZXSpectrum48kYork
Reviews.Content: I was working near Oxford Circus, so needed a hotel at the very last minute. Location is excellent, 5 minute walk from Oxford Circus. I only needed a bed for the night, so wasn't too bothered about where I stayed (I will be from now on). The family who run the hotel were very friendly and helpful when I couldn't switch the TV on (Nice LCD Sony). However. the room was so tired. 1980's decor (In fact I don't remember hotels looking this tired in the 1980's)! In the shower, broken tiles had been replaced with non fitting tiles, dirty shower screen etc. I had a sink wash (Which is in the room) as I could not face the shower. No security on the windows, so risky to have open at night, so poor ventilation led to a bad nights sleep. Spend the extra money and treat yourself to the Hilton Metropole or the Holiday Inn, I will.

Reviews.Title: “Buy a box & stay under westminster bridge”
Reviews.Author: navigator
Reviews.Content: This place is a disgrace for what it calls a 3* hotel. I had arrived early and expected to leave my luggage with hotel as arranged as room was not ready. I was informed to leave my bag in the reception area with other bags. No security at all. The person behind the desk was unwelcoming. The place looked like a bedsit with torn chairs. The room was on 4th floor. It had a lift but two max could get in it and if you have a wheelchair, forget this place. The whole place is horrible from decor, service and food. The room was very tiny with two very small wardrobes, the sink was in front of the bed for washing and shaving. Grime around taps and hairs. There was a hair dryer which when turned on gave a burning smell. An empty fridge not turned on. Broken cupboard door below sink. No air conditioning but did supply a fan. Very warm at night and fan to noisy to keep on. Shower and tiolet in one cupboard I would call it. had to do a ballet dance to get out of shower and dry off as tiolet is close to shower. Also had soap from previous occupants which had hairs on. Breakfast can only be described as basic. Sat down and served two rashers bacon which were over cooked, one sausage that looked like it had been cooked the day before and a greasy egg plus a slice of toast. If you do not eat any of that then you will have to find alternative eating else where. Checkout was with no thanks at all or was everything ok. Just working on computer and just gave me a dead look as handed key in. No point complaining here. I was glad I had only booked for one night and it needs condemed. Will not be back and the only thing going for this place was the location. Five mins from Oxford circus and Soho.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireBantam
Reviews.Content: Very poor facilities, the shower was broken, hanging down and dripping constantly. Reporting it to Reception made no difference, nothing was done. The breakfast was cold and had clearly been on the plate for some time. Can't be bothered to go on with this. NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: thirty
Reviews.Content: I was embarassed to consider what visitors to the UK who were stopping here might think. Too many faults to list. The only saving grace is the adjacency of the Stag pub just up the street

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you get the right room, location excellent”
Reviews.Author: ReikiHealer
Reviews.Content: This hotel (B&B) is located 5 minutes walk from Oxford Circus tube. The rooms are in dark wood and all en-suite. First room I had was not good - 4th floor, and although small, initially the room looked fine, on closer inpsection the loo was cracked and needed a clean, and sheets and pillow had obviously not been changed and still had marks on them. The metal shower rail was hanging off precariously. I think this room had been allocated and unfortunately had been missed to be cleaned. On showing them the problems, reception appeared genuinely apologetic and offered a better room on the first floor. They have flat screen tv's (well at least in the 2 that I saw). This is certainly not the plushest of hotels so dont expect miracles, but it was much better than I expected from the reviews before. We stay in many London hotels and review them and this was basic but fine for a base and they will try to move you if you are not happy. You just need to get the right room. It desparately needs a handy man to fix a few things, but I have frankly seen worse in more expensive hotels. You may need a fan in the room as it tends to get a bit warm even with radiator off and window open - ask reception if they have a spare. The bed was fine and confortable and the pillows fine. It was very quiet and I couldnt hear anything from the next door even though when I went out of my room into the corridor could hear them talking. I would do some research first and see if you can do a cheaper deal with various companies before you book. I didnt have the breakfast so cannot comment - but this comes inclusive with the room - which in London is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever been in. Run for your life!”
Reviews.Author: MChurchEnt
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its great location. I did not expect alot considering the price. HOWEVER, there are certain things you do expect. I had booked a room with 2 beds, and got a room with one. They did agree to bring in a rollaway, which took up every free inch of space in the extremely small room. The rollaway was missing half of the support slats, so I sunk through to the floor. The furnishings were shabby. The toilet would not flush. The shower was broken and hanging down. The housekeeping was skimpy...only leaving one towel for 2 people. There was internet available in the lobby, but some of the keys on the keyboard did not work. What I noticed.....by paying a mere $50 more a night, I could have stayed at the Marriott and been very satisfied. PLEASE, pay the extra money. This place is a dump, and will hamper your whole London experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: HomebirdLancashire
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about the Hallam is the location. It is in need of a complete refurbishment. The owners have a cheek accepting guests until this is done. We and our friends have never experienced anything like this before. In the words of a fellow guest ' it is a shed '. Our friends came back to their room on the 2nd night to find it had not been made up, the bedding piled on the mattress wet through, which had seeped through to the mattress. They waited for over an hour for this to be sorted out and ended up sleeping on 2 single uneven mattresses. We paid Â£110. per small room, it was not worth Â£10. Our friends asked for a got a refund for one night which was no less than they deserved. Surely not ENGLISH TOURIST BOARD standard as displayed at hotel. Would post photo's but I am not sure how to tansfer from PC to this review.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise of noise in a shabby hotel at ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Jelle71
Reviews.Content: We have picked the hotel due to its location and after inspecting the pictures published online. The pictures must have been taken a decade ago or photoshoped - the hotel is in run down condition. We were given a room on the lower ground level, meaning, dug below ground and facing the street through a narrow passage. The room is right next to the kitchen and facing the luandry. The personnel was coming at 6 every morning, busy preparing breakfast etc. There were only 6 tables in the breakfast room, so late birds get very late breakfast (which is a story for itself). If this is not enough, unfortunately there is a construction site just steps from the hotel, so pnemuatic drills wish a good morning at 7 am.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: rayevs
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked ok from the outside, but seemed shabby at reception. My room was very cramped - the double bed just about fitted in. The room was unbearably hot, the radiators did not switch off, but at least I could open the windows. The carpet was stained, and the bed linen was grubby-looking. The sink was in the main bedroon, not in the bathroom. All furniture looked very cheap, worn and shabby. The shower was hanging off the wall, and there was a pool of stagnant water in the base where the water was not draining out properly. The breakfast was adequate - just about. For Â£105/night I did expect a bit more than I got. (evening meal?)Needless to say I will never stay here again, and would not reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we've ever been in!”
Reviews.Author: rmc69
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the worst hotels we've ever stayed in, especially as it was recommended by a travel agent. I wouldn't recommend my worst enemy to stay here. It smelled of curry from the moment we stepped in the door. We ended up in a basement room beside the kitchen which was subject to the rumbling of underground trains every minute or so. The decoration was shabby, the room's cleanliness was suspect and the full English breakfast was anything but full! You were lucky if you got a greasy egg and a couple of pieces of equally inedible bacon! The only thing we thought would be good was the location, right beside Oxford Street and Broadcasting House, but even this was not great as most of Broadcasting House is presently a huge building site with work going on from early in the morning. All in all an awful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: smith072
Reviews.Content: All i can say is,this is a horrible hotel that i've ever been in my entire life.I've been around the world but this was a nightmare. The minute we walk in the hotel we were hit by the smell of stale curry,its really horrible. The Manager as he call himself is very rude,i wondered were has he done his hotel management !!!Room are dirty,everything about that hotel is a disaster So i wouldnt advise anyone to go to this hotel at all.thers some better hotel that are small and you can feel welcome. We booked because of the location if we new it was going to turn out like this we would have even booked ther,one night for us was enoug

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeorginaGolightly
Reviews.Content: Great location - just round the corner from Oxford Street TOPSHOP Hotel completely awful. No hand basin in the bathroom. Awful and dated interior. Smell of curry all night. Room door practically hanging off. DO NOT HAVE THE COOKED BREAKFAST!! (ask for toast and egg, only thing edible) Ok for max 1 night stay - as the bathroom is too revolting to take a shower

Reviews.Title: “Same old Hallam”
Reviews.Author: TropicalTravellerUk
Reviews.Content: Oh dear. I hadnâ€™t stayed here in a while and was hoping it might have improved, but it hasnâ€™t. Well, the room had a newish flat-screen TV, but thatâ€™s about it. The cheapest, most dated, worn-out furniture youâ€™ve ever seen, paper-thin walls and â€“ nice touch â€“ curtains hanging off the rail. The only thing this place has going for it is location: if youâ€™re going to be out all day and just want a place to sleep and nothing else, then fine. The fact that itâ€™s â€˜cheapâ€™ at Â£70 a night says more about the ridiculous price of accommodation in London than anything else. If it was any other city in the world it would be half that.

Reviews.Title: “fab choice, FAB location”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiSam67
Reviews.Content: small hotel, but not bad at all. my friend and i had a large room (by european standards) with comfy beds. the location was absolutely amazing. the walk to oxford and regent (the oxford st. tube stop) was quick. the staff was nice and accomodating (we arrived a few hours before we were able to check in, so they allowed us to leave all of our luggage in the small loby while we walked to topshop and miss selfridge to shop, and they were great in helping us get a cab to take us back to heathrow when we were leaving). the only thing i wasn't fond of was the fact that when we left the hotel at any time, we were made to leave the room key at the front desk...i got used to it, though. this isn't a ritzy hotel, but for my recent college grad budget, it was everything i could have hoped for, and more. when i go back to london, i'm probably going to stay here again. i cannot stress enough how fab the location was...

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: lollylg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business as it was a cheaper option and close to where i would be working. On arrival i was told the room had not been paid for, even though i had email confirmation. the staff were rude and confrontational. I am a young girl who was travelling alone, i did not expect to be treated this way. the man on reception told me i had to see the manger in the morning to discuss payment. my room was cold, damp, smelly and on the top floor, i wasn't prepared to use their lift! i was quickly interupted by a man who came in, took the heater and sprayed air freshener. the room was below basic and i felt very unsafe, so unsafe i took all my belongings away with me the next day. the breakfast was vial, didnt eat there the next day. the manager agreed the room had been paid for but told me i had booked 2 rooms that i needed to pay for, again he said i would have to come back later and speak to the owner. after aguing very loudly in front of other customers they accepted i wasnt going to pay. over all a hideous experience and i deter anyone from using this hovel, especially women on their own.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again, unless...”
Reviews.Author: LuckyTraveller58
Reviews.Content: There was a major construction work going on right in front of my windows = noise from 8 in the morning til 6 pm. Okay, if you're not in, during that time... - but very annoying if your'e a late sleeper and want your mornings in "peace". They offered me another room to the other side, but I had to wait till next afternoon and pack and leave the room I already got, by 11 am in the morning. I was too exhausted to do that, had had very exhausting experiences in the Airport and with the busfare to central London - and I had just packed everything out and was only staying for three days, so wouldn't spent my time on all that packing and waiting for another room. My best advice is: Buy earplugs! Because the construction work had been going on for two years already in one building and now they were building a whole new one next to that... So the receptionist said he reckoned it would take at least three more years before done... Furthermore, the hotel itself was under construction, making a new section of new rooms - right next to my room on the fourth floor (actually it was on fifth floor, but that's another story). Next issue, the hot water didn't work. It was too cold to use the first day, and the next day, after I had mentioned it, it went too hot. It was actually burning! I mentioned that, too, but after coming home 9 in the afternoon to discover it hadn't been fixed yet, I now saw a certain pattern; because the minibar, that I was depending on using as a fridge due to allergy, so I can buy and make my own sandwiches and keep milk fresh etc, hadn't been fixed either. It didn't work from day one, and I of course mentioned that at the same time I mentioned the water... I was going in the theater on the third day and now being on the second without "decent" water, I knew I had to push the hotel in order to fix it NOW. I didn't want to show up with dirty, flat hair or without having taken a decent shower, poor "neighbours" to sit next to me in the theater, if... The hotel did try to make the water, but I had to wait until 1 o'clock in the night, before they finally realised they had to offer me another room - with working water - to shower and wash my hair in. By that time I had gotten a little cranky, I admit... I was tired and had to dry my hair in the mittle of the night, it was four o'clock before i finally could lay my head on my own pillow... And knowing I would have to listen to this noise from the construction works four hours later, wasn't appealing to my "good spirit"... If the hotel get these things to work, the water issue and the fridge AND remember to tell on their website about the construction work, it's a fairly decent hotel. It's small and cosy and very near to everything in central London. The single-rooms are extremely small, but you only feel uncomfortable with that if your'e suffering from claustrophobia or is a XL type. But you wouldn't want to stay too long in these rooms, the bathroom is rather small too, and you have to "press your elbows in" in order to move around in there. The room I got to shower in though, was a "true" double room with a real double-bed and it's own shower, and space enough for it's own washing-basin placed at the end of the bed, a large mirror and lots of space in common. But I don't think the fridge worked there either...

Reviews.Title: “ok if you like basic”
Reviews.Author: j_hawksby_1999
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for me and my boyfriend for his birthday. I chose it because of its position which was very close to regent and oxford street and to the theatre which we were attending. It was very easily to find, just a short walk from oxford circus underground. unfortuently this was its only saving grace. on arrival, outside there were major construction work going on which was very loud. we were given our key and told our room was on the 3rd floor. there is a lift which was handy although we took the stairs. we only got as far as the 2nd floor as they were redecorationing and there was debris all over the stairs. when I went down stairs they were very apologetic and gave us another room. the room its self was basic. there was clean bedding and towels, kettle and a tv. we were not in there much in the evening and when we returned, it was warm and comfortable. the next morning we were rudley awakened by the decorating staff on the floor above and in the corridor. saying that, the breakfast was sufficient, there was a choice of continental or full english. it was not worth the Â£90 we paid but was comfortable enough. suitable for friends who are not going to be spending a lot of time in the hotel. not suitable for couples on romantic breaks of for families.

Reviews.Title: “Serious damp problems”
Reviews.Author: LondonKat
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hallam Hotel on behalf of a colleague for two nights. Upon arrival he was told that his room wasn't ready due to an unforeseen problem, although I called before to ensure that everything was in order. He was given a Â£10 note and told to get a taxi to a nearby hotel. So far so good. When he returned to Hallam the next day, it's gone from bad to worse... He had to check out at 5am due to a serious damp issue, which involved the bed getting soaked when it started to rain outside. My advice to sum up the experience: avoid this hotel at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Hallam Hotel in London-Poor Choice!”
Reviews.Author: mzrcom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hallam Hotel in London for 5 nights. from 5th of April until 9th of April 2007. We were very disappointed and decided never go back again to this hotel. Most of all because of the service! We were tempted to book this hotel because of its location. But the Hotel itself did not provide what we paid for. It wasnâ€™t a cheap one too and we regret booking this Hotel. We made the reservation weeks ahead for us and for a few more family members. We were 3 couples. When we arrived one of the couples got a room down in the basement. It was horrible room and smelled so bad and so we asked the reception to change their room but they didn't even though we made our reservation weeks ago. So they decided to go find other hotel because it was impossible to stay there. We were all tiered from our journey and took them all afternoon find other hotel at such a short time. The hallam hotel manager did not care their guests had to leave because of their fault. We had to stay because we could not afford to pay extra money for other hotel at the last minute. Than after wasting half a day of our trip in helping our family member to book other hotel we settled down in our room only to find out in the middle of the shower that it was broken and the water wasn't warm. We notify the reception and they send someone to fix it. The next day the shower broke down again in middle of the shower!!! We asked the reception again to sent someone to fix is as soon as possible and they said they would, only they didn't and didn't let us know. We found out about it when we took a shower!!! When we asked why wasn't it fixed they said they could not get hold to the man who was supposed to fix it but tomorrow it would be fixed for sure. Can you believe this??? We were only for 5 days and they took their time!!! Than at night it was cold and the hit wasn't working so we asked them to turn on the hit. They said they would and we waited...and waited...and when we didn't feel the room was getting any warmer we called again the reception and complained about their attitude toward us so they did us a favor and sent to our room a small radiator which was too small to hit up the whole room. We began to realize that this hotel was a low quality one and there was no point in complaining about the problems we were having to anyone. But when we checked out we told all about our stay in the hotel and about how members of our family had to leave and the manager ignored us flat out!!! He said " thank you for your staying in our hotel" and that was it. He ignored us while talking with him!!! How rude of this men! He completely looked the other way pretending to be busy!!! He was very rude and offensive and for that kind of behavior we told ourselves never go back to Hallam hotel when visiting in London again! It is worth pay the extra money and book hotel that respect itself and its guest. A hotel that it's maintenance works spotless. We deserved to get what we paid for and we didn't. Our advise; don't be temped to book this hotel, its not worth your money by far!!! There are many other hotels near by that are much better that this poor hotel. For example the Astor court just next door. It doesn't worth to spoil up the trip and waste valuable time for accommodation and maintenance problems that can truly spoil your mood over this.

Reviews.Title: “Handy but no frills”
Reviews.Author: FarfarawayHerefordUK
Reviews.Content: We booked this relatively cheap option for somewhere to rest our heads for one night after a show at the Palladium but somehow I am always disappointed when the basics are not done well. On the o.k side was the location, the size and warmth of the room, a opening window, just about reasonable towels, a working hairdryer, hot powerful shower, spare pillows, and a kettle. (How sad for all these not to be absolute givens) ....On the not so ok side was the charmless, depressing, tired old dark furniture, a broken chair that fell apart when touched, gaffer tape on the wall, grubby mismatched cups, the cheapest tiniest soaps imaginable, no pillow slips on the spare yellowing pillows, a very stained carpet, a view of concrete and tonnes of pigeon poo, and our 'continental breakfast' consisting of the offer of muesli or flakes (not seen) and 1 slice of see-through toast each with one cup of warm diluted cheap coffee dust (no self respecting continental breakfast I know of would not include juice, decent coffee, cheese, ham, a fresh roll etc. If its cereal and toast for breakfast call it that please). This place cries out for TLC, a face lift and a management that doesnt opt for the absolute cheapest of the cheap of everything. Having said that though, if they did, odds on the price would double and so with a heavy heart I say that you pays your money and you takes your choice I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Cheap but small”
Reviews.Author: lorenzo74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is central, it's is just a few minutes walk from oxford circus. If you arrive by ryanair airport transfers is just walking distance if take Marble Arch Stop. The english breakfast is ok as well but no orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cozy Hotel in Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: hang_the_dj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for about a week. The staff was friendly, service was good, and our room was smallish, but clean and bug-free. Our bathroom was tiny (just room for a shower stall and toilet), and so the sink was in the main room, along with a small fridge and electric kettle for tea. We also had a TV with 4 channels (but as the British find darts to be endlessly entertaining, I suggest you bring along a good book). The room could use a little fixing up here and there, but nothing major was wrong, and the location was truly wonderful. The tube and Oxford street shopping are just a few blocks away, and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby for easy meals. Have a great trip! Oh yes, and bring along shampoo as well, if you are a woman, (or metrosexual man) and care about such things.

Reviews.Title: “Hell Hole is right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2005. This place is horrible. The staff was very rude. I had ants with my breakfast. I had no hotwater to take a shower one morning. I had to boil water in the kettle to take a sponge bath, luckily I had brought my own washcloth. My room was not ready when I arrived. I made sure to book a hotel that had a lift since I travel with a lot of luggage. The hotel had a lift, but they booked me in the next floor above where the lift ended and I had to lug my overweight suitcases up an entire small flight of stairs. The staff refused to help me with my luggage. The room was very small, and if you stood up in the shower you hit your head on the ceiling. I have traveled for years and never have had to change my hotel in the middle of my stay, until I stayed here. When I checked out they refused to call a taxi, so I had to go hail one on the street two blocks away. Do NOT stay here, it is not worth paying any money for this place. I would recommend Bickenhall Hotel, on Gloucester Place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Crap”
Reviews.Author: kellyg_20
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the HELLam title line. I stayed for one night (thank gosh) on May 26. I arrived at 12pm and was told that I had to come back at 1 because my room was not ready. I'm not entirely sure what they did in that hour, but it certainly wasn't clean anything. The shower curtain looked like it hadn't been changed since the Boer War, there was supposedly coffee/tea services, but somehow no kettle or coffee maker to use them! Also, there was a tv, with supposedly cable. It wasn't plugged in and once I plugged it it, there was nothing. Just a snowy screen. The sheets were mildewy and stank. I would not reccomend staying at this hotel. I knew it was going to be small, and that's not the problem, but never again. If you're looking for a decent hotel, try Bayswater!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly & helpful. The room was small but adequate. We had a rollaway bed brought in for our daughter so that made it pretty cramped. If it would have been just the two of us, there would have been ample room. There was a refrigerator in the room too which was really nice. The street was very quiet with very little traffic noise and felt safe coming back late at night. The room was fairly clean but rough around the edges - furnishings were a bit worn and the bathroom could have been cleaner - there was a little mold growing in there. The only other thing was that they didn't replace the cups & coffee pot with clean ones each day - they put the dirty ones back in place & it made me wonder if they were dirty when we arrived too. There were plenty of towels in the room, unlike a previous reviewer's comment. We did have to ask for some extra ones for our daughter a couple times, but they were always cheerfully provided with no problems. The breakfast was extremely generous - eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, a tomato and juice. It was more than enough to get you through until supper and tasted very good. There was only one morning when we had to wait about 10 minutes for a table to be ready. The location was great - about 6 blocks from both Oxford Circus and Great Portland tube stations. There were several restaurants close by. I highly recommend the Turkish restaurant on Great Portland - I think the name was Effies? All in all, it was a great value for the money & we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “HELLam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My subject heading sums it up entirely. We checked in around 9 PM on May 25th for a stay of five nights, and we were out the morning of May 26th. In retrospect, we should have left immediately, late hour or not. The room was on the ground floor just behind the reception area. I had booked this dog in early December, informing them we must have a non-smoking CLEAN room, as one of us has asthma. After dragging and squeezing the luggage through two entry doors, we entered the worst room I've had the unfortunate experience to witness in over 36 years of world travel. The carpeting was stained and filthy, with hair and microbes piled up in the corners. Besides being miniscule, it had a dank odor, which I still am unable to mentally identify. The shower/toilet area was the size of the heads on a sailboat, complete with mildew and mold on the bottom sides. The shower head was broken, so it dangled over the handles. The headboard was velvet tuck and roll, which was quite handy for collecting years of dust in the crevases, which is ideal for an asthmatic. The window was open, and feathers, feces and debris from the local pidgeon convention was a pleasant touch, not to mention the view was over the back alleyway and buildings. If you've seen any classic old mystery movies, the dark alleyway scenes were shot from this window - no doubt about it. The coffee pot was left partially filled with "water" and was unfit to use. Now here comes the clencher....as soon as we'd rectified ourselves to tough it out for one night, about three minutes into the bed, the entire room began to rumble. I honestly thought there was an earthquake for several seconds. This went on for approximately every two minutes for about 2 hours - perhaps longer. Turns out this establishment (or at least our room) was directly over the metro system. The bed was so small, I ended up partially lying on the nightstand, knocking the telephone off the hook, which sent off a dial tone that I mistook for a smoke alarm. In summary, as the old adage says, "You get what you pay for..." If you want a good location, there are three other hotels right in the same area (we went to the Holiday Inn). Our friends stayed at a lovely hotel directly across the street from the Holiday Inn, and paid LESS than what this nightmare charged. Final advice - don't wreck your vacation in a lovely city by submitting to HELL....
